Roman.name: Julius Caesar's Laurel Wreath
Roman.description: A golden wreath worn by Julius Caesar during his triumphs, symbolizing victory and authority.

Roman.name: Roman Gladius
Roman.description: A short sword used by Roman soldiers, known for its effectiveness in close combat.

Roman.name: Roman Coin
Roman.description: A silver denarius featuring the portrait of an emperor, used as currency in the Roman Empire.

Roman.name: Legionary Standard
Roman.description: A banner carried by Roman legions, symbolizing the honor and pride of the unit.

Roman.name: Bronze Bust of Augustus
Roman.description: A finely crafted bronze bust of the first Roman emperor, Augustus.

Gallic.name: Vercingetorix's Helmet
Gallic.description: The helmet worn by the Gallic chieftain Vercingetorix, a symbol of resistance against Rome.

Gallic.name: Gallic Torque
Gallic.description: A neck ring made of twisted metal, worn by Gallic warriors as a symbol of status and bravery.

Gallic.name: Gallic Shield
Gallic.description: A wooden shield adorned with intricate designs, used by Gallic soldiers in battle.

Gallic.name: Gallic Pottery
Gallic.description: Decorated pottery pieces used in everyday life and rituals, showcasing Gallic artistry.

Gallic.name: Gallic Brooch
Gallic.description: A decorative brooch used to fasten clothing, often featuring animal motifs.

Egyptian.name: Tutankhamun's Mask
Egyptian.description: The iconic gold funerary mask of the young pharaoh Tutankhamun, symbolizing eternal life.

Egyptian.name: Ankh Amulet
Egyptian.description: An amulet shaped like an ankh, representing life and immortality in ancient Egyptian culture.

Egyptian.name: Scarab Beetle
Egyptian.description: A carved stone scarab beetle, symbolizing rebirth and protection in ancient Egypt.

Egyptian.name: Canopic Jar
Egyptian.description: A jar used to store the internal organs of mummies, often decorated with the heads of gods.

Egyptian.name: Cleopatra's Dagger
Egyptian.description: A ceremonial dagger believed to have belonged to Cleopatra, queen of Egypt.
